storyInfo: The non-Sankta taken into the Shrine of Nurtury are informed that Laterano will bestow halos on them. Some refuse, but they are not given a choice.

attributes.content: This is the place. Enjoy some rest.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: I thought I was going to the Notarial Hall or the Basilica, to be questioned about Arturia's escape.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: The gun-knight who brought you here has other business to attend to. He asked me to tell you not to worry about the Arturia case.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: Long has Landen Monastery served the Holy City dutifully. There will be no excessive penalty just because a single prisoner escaped.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: Phew... that's good to hear.
attributes.name: Nervous Nun

attributes.content: It was for another reason that you were brought here.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: There are so many—
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Would you prefer a quieter location?
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: No, what I mean is... why is everyone in this nursery Liberi?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Hildegard scans around the room and sees Liberi in all sorts of outfits, sitting or standing. There is little conversation, only the steady ring of the comfort bells.
Hundreds? Thousands? Too many to count. An entire city's worth of Liberi seems to be assembled here.
Since when did this nursery become so large? No, more importantly, why are all these Liberi here?
Don't tell me... you have a room full of Perros, a room full of Felines, a room full of Lupos...?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: An astute observation.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: We also have rooms for fallen angels and Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: You're... awfully forthcoming.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: The Shrine of Nurtury has nothing to hide.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: At the conclusion of the Nativity, the Curia announced that the Sankta will share the halo with all races. The simplest method is to do it race-by-race.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: Do you mean we can have halos too? We can feel each other the way Sanktas do?
attributes.name: Liberi Citizen

attributes.content: As you felt the arborbeast's heartbeat at the Nativity.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Why what?
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: Why do we need halos?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: So you brought me here, not because of Vannini, but because... I am Liberi?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: I'll get a big ol' light over my head, like yours?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Go on in, Pag.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Huh. Sounds like I don't have a choice. And it also sounds like a wonderful thing, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: At least it'll be good for your eyes.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: More than that, I think!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: If I had a halo, I'd be able to tell what that metal heart of yours was feeling when you kicked Gia out of Laterano!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: I know you blame me for that.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Glad to know that you know.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Maybe things would've gone better for you, if that hadn't happened.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Over centuries of Lateran history, many have tried to recreate the terrifying high-caliber revolving antique gun that the ancient tomes described... only you succeeded.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: That design, which assumed the user could withstand a recoil five times that of an ordinary gun, was the work of a genius... or a madman.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Oh, are you bragging about being born to be a gun-knight? After all, you successfully tested my design before ever putting on a suit of armor.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: I just thought we were born to be partners. You and I and Gia were always the best of friends, from primary school through university.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: But my first official mission as a gun-knight was to exile Gia from Laterano...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: After that, you gave up gunsmithing for the Apostolic Knights, opened a workshop somewhere I didn't know about, and now...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: I decided to retire, alright? You and your vappa 'Shrine of Gunsmithing'. What use did you Sankta have for me, if you treat gunsmithing like making potato chips?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: It's a crime to be non-Sankta, is it? Gia got exiled, I get to have a halo put on me... the Liberi aren't allowed to live in Laterano the way we are now, are we?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: The thing with Gia had nothing to do with being Liberi. Even if she was Sankta, the Lateran wouldn't allow someone with Oripathy—
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: You don't know shit!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: 'Lateran order' and 'Lateran purity' again? How many times d'you think I've heard that garbage from you?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Do you really believe in it yourself? Somnias! Dormis! How could you, if you've thought even once about how Gia died out there, alone?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: I admit, I did believe in it, Patrizion. Until that day...
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: We got hangovers together, played with guns together, cried and laughed together. No one in Laterano could clink glasses like we could.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: But when I saw Gia disappear into the wilderness, and you just turned around and went back to Laterano the way you did, that was when I realized...
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: We never actually shared a damned thing.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: The halo is not a bad thing, Sister Hildegard. It's Laterano's blessing on us.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: From the earliest nomads who followed the burdenbeasts, the Liberi had always learned from the Sankta, from their ways of living, to their ways of thinking.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: The Liberi long for a better life, and they long to be part of the Holy City. We understand that.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I told that history to Arturia not so long ago.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: But there is only one thing the Liberi can never learn from the Sankta—the halo.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: That is why certain conflicts between the Sankta and other races living in Laterano have lingered to this day.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: Unable to take part in Sankta empathy, you are troubled by doubts about your faith. You suspect Laterano of being indifferent, of alienation...
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: To help with Landen Monastery's finances, you were away from Laterano for a long time, Sister Hildegard. That is why your may not have sufficient understanding of this situation.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: You can ask your fellow Liberi...
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I know how many outsiders who live here envy your empathy.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: That is why we will now share it with everyone. There be no more misunderstandings or differences. We will truly understand one another, and eliminate the conflicts and barriers between us.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: The Liberi will become a truly inseparable part of Laterano.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: I just feel sad.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: I grew up in this city. I know where one can find the best desserts, which alleys have cloudbeasts that have a special taste for pumpkins, which buildings have rooftops perfect for stargazing.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: At Landen Monastery, I made beer and bread with the Sankta sisters, traveled to other countries to solicit sponsors, and got completely plastered whenever we came back...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I took pictures of how their wings went through the backs of their chairs when sleeping, and they played lullabies in the chapel when I sneaked out, so that the abbot would sleep a little longer.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I remember that!
attributes.name: Nervous Nun

attributes.content: Actually, the abbot knew. He just didn't want to scold you.
attributes.name: Nervous Nun

attributes.content: I'm a Lateran. I like this place. I love it very much.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: You're right that I often find myself on the outside looking in. I don't know why the Sanktas who had been crying a moment ago start laughing and singing at their cohorts' funerals.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: My father was a hunter. Every winter, he would go into the mountains with his friends to hunt.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: He told me that even hunters who have hunted together for decades can have different ideas when they see the same quarry. They sometimes even fight over it.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Everyone is different. That has nothing to do with whether or not we have a halo.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: But you tell me I won't truly become a Lateran until I have a halo.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Do you mean to say that I wasn't a true Lateran for the past twenty years?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Has my entire life been a poor imitation?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: It has, Sister Hildegard, but you should not see that as a rejection of you or any other Liberi.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: It is simply a necessity for the acceptance of Laterano.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: I don't care about rejection or acceptance.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I just don't think there's anything wrong with my life.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: And I don't see a reason why I have to accept this so-called 'blessing'.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Laterano has already made a decision, Sister Hildegard.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: It was the first time I experienced a parting, Pag.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: It... wasn't a good feeling.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: I guess that was when my life started to go off the rails.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: It's like those popcorn movies, you know. The Chainsaw Guy series, or The Bridges of Michaelion.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: First Gia, then you, then my finest student. I exiled her from Laterano personally.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: I worry, too, about Fia...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: What, you're worried that your dear granddaughter might run away and you'll die alone?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: You all had your issues. I tried to do something, but never actually helped anyone.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Did you really try, or are you just lying to yourself to feel better?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Maybe both.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: But there's something you got wrong. I support the idea of halos for everyone, not only because I want to protect the 'order' and 'purity' of the Holy City...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: You're making Laterano sound awfully racist by putting it this way.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: A Laterano where everyone shares the halo will truly become one and whole. We'll be able to solve the unimaginable calamity that threatens all of Terra.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: It'll also solve all the other problems we've been having, including...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Anyway, I think that's enough sharing for now.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Deo gratias! Thank God that's over.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Hearing all that garbage from you again is making me sick to my stomach.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Go on in, Pag.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: And if I say no?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: I don't want that light show you've got on your head. And I've got no interest in studying your honorable motives.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Paganini levels his gun at the gun-knight.
Just give it a minute.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: You're a genius gunsmith, Pag, but you're a Liberi.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: You can't use the guns you make. They're just your calling cards.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: If you're really that furious with me, give it until the ceremony, then you can put a bullet in me.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Once you have a halo, you'll be able to use it—
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Paganini smashes the gun against the knight's armor. Pieces fly in all directions, and the broken gun stock makes a dull thud as it hits the ground in the distance, echoing throughout the corridor.
Go on in, Pag.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Legatus Mostima. 'Overseer' Fiammetta.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: Your contribution to Laterano is much appreciated. Now, kindly come this way...
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: To the nurseries already filled to the brim?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: The ceremony is about to begin. The Matriarch will first enlighten the Liberi who have lived in Laterano for many years. Then, the broken halos and wings of the fallen angels will be repaired.
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: Quickly now. I will lead the way...
attributes.name: Nurturer

attributes.content: Heh.
